name: Add support to array associations using UUID
body: This version removes the assumption that associations are made using an integer type. It now does not take much into consideration the type, leaving PG to figure the type out or raise errors.

name: Add support to array associations using UUID
body: This version removes the assumption that associations are made using an integer type. It now does not take much into consideration the type, leaving PG to figure the type out or raise errors.

name: Add support to Rails 7.0
body:
Add support to Rails 7.

Adapted super for enums since Rails 7 includes its own method to create enums.
IMPORTANT! A lot has changed in the associations' area, so beware that it may contain issues, even though all tests here are green.

name: Fix for Rails 6.1.5
body: With the new minor version for Rails 6, there was an issue with managing array associations with loading records and adding records at the same time. This is fixed in this version.

name: Fix problem with default value
body: * Changing the default value was breaking due to a different class coming as the column

name: Bug fixes
body:
* Fix problem with recent version of Ruby
* Fix problem with default value

name: Inheritance improvement and General fixes
body:
* Improve inheritance by not relying on Auxilary Statement
* Add extended support for default values
* Fix an error with default values, array, and jsonb columns
* Fix an error with the most recent versions of Rails
* Fix an error with the `current?` method for period columns

name: Fix enum and table inheritance
body:
* Make sure that table inheritance, more specifically `.cast_record` works with `uuid` columns
* Change query that fetches the enum values to a more verbose one and transaction-safe

name: Fix to association cache
body: Fix #48 by disabling cache for associations connected using array columns.

name: Fixes to belongs to many
body:
* Improves around array and default value
* Fix save action when saving the association

name: Fix to belongs to many and enum
body:
* Fixed a problem with ENUM that prevent it to follow Rails pattern
* Fixed a problem with BelongsToMany where direct changes to the ids were not being saved

name: Insert All (upsert_all) with where condition
body:
### New Features
* Allow [`upsert_all`](https://api.rubyonrails.org/classes/ActiveRecord/Persistence/ClassMethods.html#method-i-upsert_all) to receive a `where` condition to filter what records will be updated
* Adjust `belongs_to_many` to support default value as `[]`

name: Belongs to Many refactor
body:
- Closes #56 and #54
- Improve performance by saving only once in sequential operations like `concat` and `replace`
- Fixed inversion between `BelongsToMany <=> HasMany(Array)`
- Add more tests to ensure seamless operations
- Better integration with AutoSave association
- Added compatibility with `FX`

name: Association fixes
body:
- Temporary fix for cached statements, which was causing problems with association queries.
- Allow builder methods to be used on views
- Fix save of belongs to many associations

name: Add support to Rails 6.1
body: It also includes a string performance improvement.

name: Foreign key fix for belongs to many
body: * Now `foreign_key` option and method both points to the right foreign key in the declared model

name: Foreign key fix for belongs to many
body: * Now `foreign_key` option and method both points to the right foreign key in the declared model

name: Scenic integration
body: Add integration to Scenic gem, so that its views can also be dumped on Schema dump

name: Scenic integration
body: Add integration to Scenic gem, so that its views can also be dumped on Schema dump

name: Small fixes
body:
* Sort enums while writing the schema dump
* Added extra tests for insurance

name: Small fixes
body:
* Sort enums while writing the schema dump
* Added extra tests for insurance

name: Rails 6.0 and Ruby 2.7 compatibility
body: This version enables the gem to work with Rails 6 and it also removes warnings regarding Ruby 2.7 named argument.

name: Fix multiple join sources from the same CTE
body: Clear the list of join sources every time that a CTE is built, avoiding wrong information or duplicated ones.

name: Fix auxiliary statements
body: New Active Record version implemented an Immutable exception for Arel queries. Since CTEs rely on joins, this fixes how the joins are built during the query.

name: Fix performance issue
body:
- Fix performance problems for applications that doesn't use inheritance;
- Fix specs by dropping the database before running it again.

name: Fixes to array associations and enum
body:
* Join on array associations were broken on rails 5.2.3 or higher
* Improve enum builder to use similar tools as the Interval, which use generated strings
* Fix array set scopes to properly cast the values while querying
* Add setting to raise an exception (or just notify) whenever the enum will build a method on top of an existing one
* Add additional scopes `has_` and `has_any_` for enum sets
* Add ability to get the enum values as symbols using `Enum::Roles.keys` or `Model.roles_keys`

name: General Improvements
body:
* Several bug fixes
* A bunch of performance improvements
* Removed some inconsistencies
* Improve inheritance cast of records with conflicting column names

name: Small fixes
body: Just small fixes for geometries and associations.

name: A bunch of new Features
body:
## Incompatibility on

- Auxiliary statements
- Enum

## How to Upgrade

- Remove any use of cached auxiliary statements from the code, because there's no more caching for those.
- Enums cannot be auto-initiated anymore, ensure to call `enum :column` on the models.

## New Features

- [Range extensions](https://github.com/crashtech/torque-postgresql/wiki/Range)
- [Period decorator](https://github.com/crashtech/torque-postgresql/wiki/Date-Time-Range)
- [Enum Set](https://github.com/crashtech/torque-postgresql/wiki/EnumSet)
- [Box datatype](https://github.com/crashtech/torque-postgresql/wiki/Box)
- [Circle datatype](https://github.com/crashtech/torque-postgresql/wiki/Circle)
- [Line datatype](https://github.com/crashtech/torque-postgresql/wiki/Line)
- [Segment datatype](https://github.com/crashtech/torque-postgresql/wiki/Segment)
- [Has Many connected through array](https://github.com/crashtech/torque-postgresql/wiki/Has-Many)
- [Belongs to Many association](https://github.com/crashtech/torque-postgresql/wiki/Belongs-to-Many)

name: General fixes and improvements
body:
1. Fix issue with Enum and Inheritance
2. Fix error with Rails 2.2
3. Fix schema dumper trying to export types defined by extensions

name: Issues fixes and improvements
body:
- Fix issue with base class identification
- Fix problem when converting an interval with a `weeks` part
- Fix how Enum are initialized to make sure alternative name works
- Enum improvements
- Inheritance cache improvements

name: Rails 5.2 support
body: Adding support to Rails 5.2

name: Fix cast records with calculations
body: When using `cast_records` with filter, use the join table to filter the models, instead of the base table, allowing calculations like `sum` to happen correctly

name: Fix Ruby Crash
body: An early return while building enum decorators caused Ruby to crash. Changed `return` to `break` fixed the problem.

name: Fixes to specs
body: Features that were not provided yet were removed from specs

name: Enum improvements and fixes
body:
* Fix enum default value on schema
* Fix enum scopes methods

name: Fix issue with merger and dynamic selection
Improvements to querying and enums
body:
- Fix issue with calculated operations like `.count` and `.sum`
- Fix issue related to `USING`, since join tables can have a similar attribute name
- Allow enums to be used as normal arrays

name: Fix for Schema Cache
body: For some reason, there's a situation where the `@data_sources` on the Schema Cache gets a key-value pair of nil, breaking the sort. The issue is fixed on this version.

name: Production bug fixes
body:
- Remove it form `eager_load_namespaces`
- Cache table_name/model on `reset_table_name`
- Ensure that the GEM runs on production mode

name: Fixes to Auxiliary Statements and Logging
body:
- Fix query logging display
- Fix inherited auxiliary statements lookup

name: Fixes to inheritance table
body:
- Improve lookup model method
- Fix integration with `annotate` GEM

name: Inheritance features
body:
Fixes some minimal bugs and provides some wanted features.

The biggest addition is the [Inherited Tables](https://github.com/crashtech/torque-postgresql/wiki/Inherited-Tables) feature.

#### Querying
* Dynamic Attributes
* Inherited Tables

name: v0.1.2
body: Basically adjust GEM compatibility with Rails new version.

name: v0.1.1
body:
General bug fixes

* #4 Interval localization
* Array fatal bug correction

name: v0.1.0
body:
First initial GEM version, with the following features:

* Configuring

#### Data types
* Enum
* Interval

#### Querying
* Distinct On
* Auxiliary Statements
